stories.text:
I’ve been a React dev for several years and used to enjoy it more, but recently I’ve gotten more frustrated by how time-consuming the styling is. It feels like most of my time is spent messing with CSS and divs.

I just recently learned SwiftUI for a side project and it’s been a breath of fresh air. I love the simplicity of the different Stack types and how the modifiers can chain together. I love how the layout engine works and how intuitive it is to determine how to space things out. It feels so easy to read, write, and take a design from blank space to completion.

I’m wondering if there are any libraries in React-land that are similar. I’ve come across Chakra, which looks somewhat close, but a glance at some examples make it look a bit more complex. Has anyone either used Chakra and can comment on it or used other React/component libraries that bring SwiftUI layout concepts to the web?
stories.title: Ask HN: SwiftUI Layout Concepts in React
